Curriculum Audit New Haven Public Schools

span.p: Dear Families of New Haven Public Schools:
I can only imagine how difficult it is for you and our children in these times of uncertainties.

My greatest concern is that you are safe and in good health. We are in difficult times as we face the possibility of longer school closer, self-quarantine, and other restrictions. I need you to know that the teachers, staff, and administrators are very concerned and are planning for next steps should this closure prolong. It is not anyones fault, so please know that your students will not be held accountable for not being able to access learning. Do whatever you can to support learning at home. Our staff cannot go back in the schools to copy materials, and we will have to increase our on line activities for students. We need to keep our children calm and reassure them that we care about and love them and our jobs right now is to keep them safe. Listen to and follow health guidelines.

Many of our students are concerned about graduation, but many requirements will have to be waived. We continue to work with the State Department of Education to guide us regarding the continuity of learning. Decisions are continuously changing based on daily updates from our Health officials. Please stay safe.

Email us if you have any questions. Superintendent Iline.tracey@new-haven.k12.ct.us, grades k-8 Keisha.hannans@new-haven.k12.ct.us, grades 9-12 Paul.Whyte@new-haven.k12.ct.us, Special education Tiffany.Jackson@new-haven.k12.ct.us, Family Engagement Gemma.joseph-lumpkin@new-haven.k12.ct.us, Early Childhood Pam.Augustine-jefferson@new-haven.k12.ct.us, Choice and Enrollment Marquelle.middleton@new-haven.k12.ct.us.

We are requesting that a parent or student complete a quick technology access survey.
Clicknhps.net/learning to access the survey and more options to learn at home.
Apreciadas Familias de las Escuelas Pblicas de New Haven:
Solo puedo imaginar lo difcil que es para ustedes y nuestros nios en estos tiempos de incertidumbre.

Mi mayor preocupacin es que ustedes estn seguros y en buena salud. Estamos en tiempos difciles cuando nos enfrentamos a la posibilidad de que las escuelas permanezcan cerradas por un periodo ms prolongado, cuarentena y otras restricciones. Necesito que sepan que los maestros, el personal y los administradores estn muy preocupados y estn planeando los prximos pasos en caso de que este cierre se prolongue. No es culpa de nadie, as que tenga en cuenta que sus hijos no sern responsables en caso de que no puedan tener acceso al aprendizaje en lnea. Haga lo que le sea posible para apoyar el aprendizaje en casa. Nuestro personal no puede regresar a las escuelas para copiar materiales, y tendremos que aumentar nuestras actividades en lnea para los estudiantes. Necesitamos mantener a nuestros nios tranquilos y
asegurarles que nos preocupamos y los amamos, y nuestro trabajo en este momento es mantenerlos a salvo. Escuche y siga las pautas de salud.

Muchos de nuestros estudiantes estn preocupados por la graduacin, pero tendremos que obviar muchos de los requisitos. Continuamos trabajando con el Departamento de Educacin del Estado para guiarnos con respecto a la continuidad del aprendizaje. Las decisiones cambian continuamente segn las actualizaciones diarias de nuestros funcionarios de salud. Por favor mantngase a salvo.

Si tiene alguna pregunta se puede comunicar con nosotros a travs de un correo electrnico. Superintendente Iline.tracey@new-haven.k12.ct.us, grados k-8 Keisha.hannans@new-haven.k12.ct.us, grados 9-12 Paul.Whyte@new-haven.k12.ct.us, Educacin Especial Tiffany.Jackson@new-haven.k12.ct.us, Participacin de Familias Gemma.joseph-lumpkin@new-haven.k12.ct.us, Educacin Preescolar Pam.Augustine-jefferson@new-haven.k12.ct.us, Eleccin e Inscripcin Marquelle.middleton@new-haven.k12.ct.us.

We are requesting that a parent or student complete a quick technology access survey.
Clicknhps.net/learning to access the survey and more options to learn at home.
